learning.title: WebSocket Message Field Paradox - Frontend/Backend Disconnect

issue.description: Silent failure where frontend sends user messages with 'content' field but backend message handler expects 'text' field, causing agents to never start.
issue.root_cause: Schema (UserMessagePayload) correctly defines 'content' field, but message handler implementation (_extract_message_data) was looking for 'text' field.
issue.symptoms: - Frontend sends: { type: "user_message", payload: { content: "...", references: [] } } - Backend receives message but extracts empty string for text - Agent supervisor.run() never gets called with actual user request - No error messages or warnings logged - WebSocket connection remains active but unresponsive

discovery.step: Frontend inspection showed 'content' field being sent
Message handler implementation was using payload.get("text", "")
This mismatch caused silent extraction failure

fix.change: Updated _extract_message_data to accept both 'content' and 'text' fields: text = payload.get("content") or payload.get("text", "")
Added empty message validation to prevent wasted agent resources: if not text or not text.strip(): send error and return
Added debug logging to track message processing and payload keys

testing_gap.issue: Integration tests did not catch this field mismatch
testing_gap.reason: Tests were mocking message handlers rather than testing actual field extraction
testing_gap.recommendation: Add end-to-end tests that verify actual payload field mapping between frontend and backend

prevention.action: Ensure schema definitions are the single source of truth
Add validation that logs warnings for unexpected field names
Create integration tests that use actual frontend payloads
Add field name validation in message handlers

lessons.lesson: Silent failures are the worst - always log when expected data is missing
Schema and implementation must be kept in sync
Field name consistency across frontend/backend is critical
Integration tests must test actual data flow, not mocked handlers
Empty messages should be rejected early to prevent wasted agent resources
First message without thread context DOES create thread and start agent properly
Error messages to users should be clear and actionable

agent_startup_verification.confirmed: Agent DOES start on first message without prior context

flow.step: System calls get_or_create_thread to create new thread
Run is created for the thread
Supervisor context is set (thread_id, user_id, db_session)
supervisor.run() is called with message text

requirements.requirement: Message content must not be empty
